criteria: Ability to derive the equation of a circle given its center and radius using the Pythagorean Theorem.
Skill in completing the square to find the center and radius of a circle from its equation.
Accuracy in identifying the center and radius from the derived equation or completed square form.
descriptions: No attempt to derive the equation or demonstrates no understanding of the Pythagorean Theorem.
Attempts to use the Pythagorean Theorem but makes significant errors in application or derivation.
Derives the equation with some errors, indicating a partial understanding of the Pythagorean Theorem.
Derives the equation correctly with minor errors or omissions.
Accurately derives the equation of a circle using the Pythagorean Theorem with clear and logical steps.
Demonstrates a thorough understanding by deriving the equation efficiently and explaining the connection to the Pythagorean Theorem comprehensively.
No attempt to complete the square or demonstrates no understanding of the process.
Attempts to complete the square but makes significant algebraic errors.
Completes the square with some errors, indicating a partial understanding of the process.
Completes the square correctly with minor errors or omissions in finding the center and radius.
Accurately completes the square and correctly identifies the center and radius of the circle.
Demonstrates a thorough understanding by efficiently completing the square and explaining each step with precision.
Unable to identify the center or radius from any form of the equation.
Incorrectly identifies both the center and radius, showing a lack of understanding of their relationship to the equation.
Identifies either the center or the radius correctly, but not both.
Identifies both the center and radius with minor errors in sign or magnitude.
Accurately identifies the center and radius from the circle's equation.
Clearly and accurately identifies the center and radius, explaining their significance in the context of the circle's properties.
